contentrichtext.text: The '''Yokota family''', husband Shigeru (born November 14, 1932) and wife Sakie (born February 4, 1936) along with their twins sons Takuya and Testuya founded the [[Japan]]ese [[National Association for the Rescue of Japanese Kidnapped by North Korea]] in 1997. The Association supports the victims of [[North Korean abductions of Japanese|North Korea's abductions of Japanese citizens]] in the late 1970s and early 1980s. The Yokota's daughter [[Megumi Yokota|Megumi]] was kidnapped in 1977 by North Korean Spies. Recently, Sakie Yokota was able to meet with the President Bush to further talks about demanding sanctions on North Korea. ==See also== * [[North Korean abductions of Japanese]] * ''[[Abduction: The Megumi Yokota Story]]'' * ''[[Megumi (manga)]]'' *[http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Korea/KD28Dg01.html "Parental love versus Kim Jong-il"], By [[Kosuke Takahashi]] of [[Asia Times Online]], April 28, 2009. ==External links== *[http://www.sukuukai.jp/narkn/index.html NARKN website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Yokota}} [[Category:1930s births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Japanese families]] [[Category:Japanese human rights activists]] [[Category:North Korean abductions of Japanese citizens]] {{Japan-activist-stub}}
